The constant sequence in a metric space is Cauchy.

lemma cauchySeq_const' {X : Type u} [MetricSpace X] (x : X) : CauchySeq (fun _ : => x) := by simpa using (cauchySeq_const (x := x) : CauchySeq (fun _ : => x))

The canonical map formal-limit completion, sending Unknown identifier `x`x to the constant sequence.

def completionViaFormalLimitsIota (X : Type u) [MetricSpace X] : X CompletionViaFormalLimits X := fun x => Quotient.mk (FormalLimitSetoid (X := X)) fun _ : => x, cauchySeq_const' (X := X) x

Proposition 1.25: Let (sorry, sorry) : ?m.1 ?m.2(Unknown identifier `X`X,Unknown identifier `d`d) be a metric space, let be the set of equivalence classes of Cauchy sequences in Unknown identifier `X`X, and define . Equality in Unknown identifier `X`X is equivalent to equality in the formal completion via Unknown identifier `iota`iota.

lemma completionViaFormalLimitsIota_eq_iff {X : Type u} [MetricSpace X] (x y : X) : x = y completionViaFormalLimitsIota X x = completionViaFormalLimitsIota X y := by constructor intro hxy exact congrArg (completionViaFormalLimitsIota X) hxy intro hxy have hxy' : Quotient.mk (FormalLimitSetoid (X := X)) fun _ : => x, cauchySeq_const' (X := X) x = Quotient.mk (FormalLimitSetoid (X := X)) fun _ : => y, cauchySeq_const' (X := X) y := by simpa [completionViaFormalLimitsIota] using hxy have hrel : FormalLimitRel (X := X) fun _ : => x, cauchySeq_const' (X := X) x fun _ : => y, cauchySeq_const' (X := X) y := Quotient.exact hxy' have hlim : Tendsto (fun _ : => dist x y) atTop (nhds 0) := by simpa [FormalLimitRel] using hrel have hconst : Tendsto (fun _ : => dist x y) atTop (nhds (dist x y)) := by simpa using (tendsto_const_nhds : Tendsto (fun _ : => dist x y) atTop (nhds (dist x y))) have hzero : dist x y = 0 := tendsto_nhds_unique hconst hlim exact (dist_eq_zero).1 hzero

The canonical map into the formal completion preserves distances.

lemma completionViaFormalLimitsIota_dist {X : Type u} [MetricSpace X] (x y : X) : dist x y = completionViaFormalLimitsDist X (completionViaFormalLimitsIota X x) (completionViaFormalLimitsIota X y) := by have hcy : CauchySeq (fun _ : => dist x y) := by simpa using (cauchySeq_const (x := dist x y) : CauchySeq (fun _ : => dist x y)) have hlim : Tendsto (fun _ : => dist x y) atTop (nhds (limUnder atTop (fun _ : => dist x y))) := by simpa using (CauchySeq.tendsto_limUnder hcy) have hconst : Tendsto (fun _ : => dist x y) atTop (nhds (dist x y)) := by simpa using (tendsto_const_nhds : Tendsto (fun _ : => dist x y) atTop (nhds (dist x y))) have hlim_eq : limUnder atTop (fun _ : => dist x y) = dist x y := tendsto_nhds_unique hlim hconst have hdist_eq : helperForProposition_1_24_formalLimitDist (X := X) fun _ : => x, cauchySeq_const' (X := X) x fun _ : => y, cauchySeq_const' (X := X) y = dist x y := by simpa [helperForProposition_1_24_formalLimitDist] using hlim_eq simpa [completionViaFormalLimitsDist, completionViaFormalLimitsIota, hdist_eq]

The canonical embedding into the formal completion is an isometry.

theorem completionViaFormalLimitsIota_isometry {X : Type u} [MetricSpace X] : Isometry (completionViaFormalLimitsIota X) := by refine (isometry_iff_dist_eq).2 ?_ intro x y simpa using (completionViaFormalLimitsIota_dist (X := X) x y).symm

Helper for Proposition 1.26: each formal limit class lies in the closure of the canonical image of Unknown identifier `X`X.

Proposition 1.26: Let (sorry, sorry) : ?m.1 ?m.2(Unknown identifier `X`X,Unknown identifier `d`d) be a metric space. Let be the completion of Unknown identifier `X`X constructed by formal limits, and identify Unknown identifier `X`X with its canonical image in Unknown identifier `Xbar`Xbar. Then Unknown identifier `Xbar`Xbar is the closure of Unknown identifier `X`X in Unknown identifier `Xbar`Xbar, i.e. Unknown identifier `Xbar`sorry = sorry ^ sorry : PropXbar = Unknown identifier `closure_X`closure_X^overloaded, errors 2:3 Unknown identifier `Xbar` invalid {...} notation, expected type is not known{Xbar}.

/- The formal-limit completion is the closure of the canonical image of `X`. -/ theorem completionViaFormalLimits_closure_range (X : Type u) [MetricSpace X] : closure (Set.range (completionViaFormalLimitsIota X)) = (Set.univ : Set (CompletionViaFormalLimits X)) := by have hdense : DenseRange (completionViaFormalLimitsIota X) := helperForProposition_1_26_denseRange_iota (X := X) simpa using (DenseRange.closure_range hdense)

Proposition 1.27: Let (sorry, sorry) : ?m.1 ?m.2(Unknown identifier `X`X,Unknown identifier `d`d) be a metric space. Let be the completion of Unknown identifier `X`X constructed via formal limits of Cauchy sequences, and identify Unknown identifier `X`X with its canonical image in Unknown identifier `Xbar`Xbar. Let (Unknown identifier `x_n`x_n) be a Cauchy sequence in Unknown identifier `X`X that converges to Unknown identifier `x`x in Unknown identifier `X`X. Then the limit of (Unknown identifier `x_n`x_n) in equals the embedded point Unknown identifier `x`x in Unknown identifier `Xbar`Xbar, i.e. . A convergent Cauchy sequence has formal-limit class equal to the embedded limit.

theorem completionViaFormalLimits_limit_eq_iota {X : Type u} [MetricSpace X] (x : X) {x0 : X} (hx : CauchySeq x) (hlim : Tendsto x atTop (nhds x0)) : Quotient.mk (FormalLimitSetoid (X := X)) x, hx = completionViaFormalLimitsIota X x0 := by have hrel : FormalLimitRel (X := X) x, hx fun _ : => x0, cauchySeq_const' (X := X) x0 := helperForProposition_1_27_formalLimitRel_const_of_tendsto (x := x) (x0 := x0) hx hlim have hquot : Quotient.mk (FormalLimitSetoid (X := X)) x, hx = Quotient.mk (FormalLimitSetoid (X := X)) fun _ : => x0, cauchySeq_const' (X := X) x0 := Quotient.sound hrel simpa [completionViaFormalLimitsIota] using hquot

Proposition 1.33 (Complete subspaces are closed): Let (sorry, sorry) : ?m.1 ?m.2(Unknown identifier `X`X,Unknown identifier `d`d) be a metric space and let Unknown identifier `Y`sorry sorry : PropY Unknown identifier `X`X be a subspace. If the metric subspace is complete, then Unknown identifier `Y`Y is closed in Unknown identifier `X`X.

/- A complete metric subspace is closed in the ambient space. -/ theorem completeSpace_subtype_isClosed {X : Type*} [MetricSpace X] {Y : Set X} : CompleteSpace Y IsClosed Y := by intro hY exact (completeSpace_subtype_closed (X := X) (Y := Y)).1 hY

Proposition 1.34 (Closed subspaces of complete spaces are complete): Let (sorry, sorry) : ?m.1 ?m.2(Unknown identifier `X`X,Unknown identifier `d`d) be a complete metric space and let Unknown identifier `Y`sorry sorry : PropY Unknown identifier `X`X be a closed subset. Then the metric subspace is complete.

/- A closed subset of a complete metric space is complete as a subspace. -/ theorem completeSpace_subtype_of_isClosed {X : Type*} [MetricSpace X] {Y : Set X} : CompleteSpace X IsClosed Y CompleteSpace Y := by intro hX hClosed exact (completeSpace_subtype_closed (X := X) (Y := Y)).2 hX hClosed

Proposition 1.37 (Existence of completion): Let (sorry, sorry) : ?m.1 ?m.2(Unknown identifier `X`X,Unknown identifier `d`d) be a metric space. There exists a complete metric space and an isometric embedding such that is dense in .

theorem exists_completion_metricSpace (X : Type u) [MetricSpace X] : (Xbar : Type u) (inst : MetricSpace Xbar), (letI := inst; CompleteSpace Xbar iota : X Xbar, Isometry iota DenseRange iota) := by refine CompletionViaFormalLimits X, completionViaFormalLimitsMetricSpace (X := X), ?_ dsimp refine And.intro ?_ ?_ exact completionViaFormalLimits_completeSpace (X := X) refine completionViaFormalLimitsIota X, ?_, ?_ exact completionViaFormalLimitsIota_isometry (X := X) exact helperForProposition_1_26_denseRange_iota (X := X)
